author: marioevz
content:
Hey all, I might be missing something but I don't quite understand from the EIP what should be the RLP format that is expected in eth_sendRawTransaction for a transaction containing full blobs.
Is it `rlp([tx_payload, blobs, commitments, proofs])`?

author: g11tech
content: also each blob is flattened byte vector (32 byte left padded big endian field elements)

author: marioevz
content: Isn't it a problem for ELs to receive this format and not have the `BLOB_TX_TYPE` at the beginning to know that they are receiving a blob tx ?

author: g11tech
content: yes the full network tx serialized is: TXTYPE || RLP(...)

author: g11tech
content: this is Transaction Payload for network format, full TX as per EIP-2718 is: `TransactionType || TransactionPayload`

author: marioevz
content: Thanks, this makes it more clear now üëç

author: marioevz
content:
Hey <@792822129019584562>, <@277500722655002624> and I were having a discussion about the `tx_payload` contained in the network version of the RLP, we had two different interpretations of the format from the EIP description:
```
BLOT_TX_TYPE || 
[
 string([ chain_id, ...]),
 [0xb10b,0xb10b,0xb10b] 
 [0xc000,0xc000,0xc000] 
 [0xc000,0xc000,0xc000] 
]
vs
BLOT_TX_TYPE || 
[
 [ chain_id, ...],
 [0xb10b,0xb10b,0xb10b] 
 [0xc000,0xc000,0xc000] 
 [0xc000,0xc000,0xc000] 
]
```

author: marioevz
content: And I guess the second one does make more sense, but what confused me to think it was the first version is that the network `tx_payload` is described as "standard EIP-2718 blob transaction TransactionPayload", and the `TransactionPayload` before is described as `rlp([chain_id, ...])`

author: g11tech
content: the second one is what i have implemented in ethereumjs

author: g11tech
content: (I agree second one makes more sense)

author: g11tech
content: I think for clarity of semantics we should have `tx_payload_body` and a corresponding `TransactionPayloadBody`

author: g11tech
content: let me try doing the EIP update to clarify

author: g11tech
content: good catch, we were doing `tx_payload.` references in the network section while defining it as `TransactionPayload` bytes
